title: ‘It's like gentle parenting': Restaurant hostess explains how to stop guests from asking ‘stupid’ questions and shares an IRL video of her using her technique at work
description: When you work in the service industry, you meet hundreds if not thousands of people that just blow your mind with how helpless they are. People really come to you for the easiest, most quickly solvable situations simply because they don't feel like doing it. It's ridiculous. If you don't understand, you have never worked at a restaurant or bar and it's showing… Guests will come up to servers, whose job is to take your order and give you your order, or hostess, whose jobs is to seat everyone as timely and organized as possible, and STILL ask questions that have nothing to do with their job description. Of course, most people who work in the service industry will just answer the question and go roll their eyes in the walk-in afterwards. But wouldn't it be nice if we DIDN'T have to do that? Perhaps provide these types of customer with a little gentle parenting on how to figure out simple question on their own? Well, one hostess has perfected a technique that does just that!
author: Elna McHilderson

title: Apartment owner reports HOA board member neighbor for breaking apartment building bylaws they helped set: ‘He is 1/3 of the HOA board in an 8 unit building’
description: Part of the responsibility of setting rules is that you have to follow them. It is inconvenient, to be sure, but all you really need to do to avoid that inconvenience is make sure that you're setting fair rules that everyone, including yourself, should be following for the betterment of everyone affected. Everyone despises their HOA, but undoubtedly, rules like this are important when it comes to the fair enjoyment of your own space. No one likes to hear unnecessary noise from a neighbor.It's just especially ironic that this neighbor also happened to be one of only three board members for the complex… holding ⅓ of the power for the entire HOA, and he still couldn't follow the rules. Not to mention, he clearly intends to rent his unit out, which will mean an even more uncontrolled amount of noise for this downstairs neighbor.The downstairs neighbor shared their experience with this online community, wondering if they were in the wrong for reporting the breaches their upstairs neighbor, who was on the HOA board, had committed.
author: Brad Dickson

title: Relative Pain
description: After those first Marvel Rivals streams, where our celestial betters were allowed to frolic and play amongst the stars, I felt sorta confident not engaging with it. Every hero I saw in this hero shooter seemed to be a kind of gumbo made from the rinds and tailings of the Overwatch characters they'd mined out. I saw them pushing the kind of cart I was already sick of pushing when I was pushing carts before I quit Overwatch. And then they showed Squirrel Girl.

title: 20 Cats Causing Chaos on Christmas Trees to Celebrate the Most Meownderful Time of the Year
description: It's that time again. The time of Christmas trees and lights and joy and chaos. So much chaos. Specifically to cat owners. Because everyone knows that for some reason, every year, cats decide to have a war with Christmas. Or maybe it's not a war. Maybe it's love that's making cats get inside of Christmas trees the second that they are put up. But everyone knows that love can lead to chaos, and the same is true for cats and Christmas trees.And so, another year, and the madness continues. It's only the beginning of December, and not all of us have put up their trees yet, but the ones of us who decided to start the party a little earlier than most are already experiencing the meowgic of Christmas, because cats don't care how early, they will get up on those Christmas trees and make sure that the party starts instantly.
author: Marielru

title: A Flurry of Fluffy Feline Funnies for Fuzzy Feline Expurrts to Purruse While Weathering the Cold Winter Winds
description: Brrrrrrrrr….it's cold outside, feline fam! All of a sudden, we're wrapped up in giant, poofy coats, bundled up in scarves and hats, and wishing we were back inside underneath the coziness of our comforters (well, that's nothing new). With this cold winter weather and the sun going down earlier and earlier, we can't be bothered to go outside at all. In fact, we've been inside so much that even our cats are starting to get tired of us! That's why we've collected a flurry of feline funnies for you to pursue while weathering the cold winter winds (from the warmth of your own home).No matter rain or shine, snow or sleet, these cold-weather cat memes are sure to keep your hearts and fingers warm while any sort of storm rages outside. Now we just need a cup of hot chocolate to keep us company while our cats take up the whole heater. Not only is it the purrfect day to stay inside, but it's also the purrfect day to scroll through these feline funnies. Enjoy!
author: Blakeseidel

title: Clearly, I come by it honestly. And by “it” I mean “playful insanity”.

title: CodeSOD: Building Blocks
description: Eli sends us something that's not quite a code sample, despite coming from code. It's not a representative line, because it's many lines. But it certainly is representative. Here's the end of one of their code files: }); } } ); }); } ) ); } }); } } ); }); I feel like someone heard that JavaScript could do functional programming and decided to write LISP. That's a lot of nested blocks. I don't know what the code looks like, but also I don't want to know what the code looks like. Also, as someone who programs with a large font size, this is a special kind of hell for me. [Advertisement] Picking up NuGet is easy. Getting good at it takes time. Download our guide to learn the best practice of NuGet for the Enterprise.
author: Remy Porter

title: CodeSOD: On VVVacation
description: As often happens, Luka started some work but didn't get it across the finish line before a scheduled vacation. No problem: just hand it off to another experienced developer. Luka went off for a nice holiday, the other developer hammered away at code, and when Luka came back, there was this lovely method already merged to production, sitting and waiting: vvv(x, y) { return typeof x[y] !== 'undefined'; } "What is this?" Luka asked. "Oh, it's a helper function to check if a property is defined on an object." Luka could see that much, but that didn't really answer the question. First, it wasn't the correct way to check if a property existed. Mind you, actually doing those checks in JavaScript is a complicated minefield because of prototype inheritance, but between the in operator, the hasOwn and hasOwnProperty methods, there are simpler and cleaner ways to get there. But of course, that wasn't what got anyone's attention. What caught Luka up was the name of the function: vvv. And not only was it a terrible name, thanks to the other dev's industriousness, it was now called all over the codebase. Even places where a more "correct" call had been used had been refactored to use this method. "But it's so brief, and memorable," the developer said. Luka was vvvery upset by that attitude. [Advertisement] Keep all your packages and Docker containers in one place, scan for vulnerabilities, and control who can access different feeds. ProGet installs in minutes and has a powerful free version with a lot of great features that you can upgrade when ready.Learn more.
author: Remy Porter

title: UnitedHealthcare CEO Killed
description: Brian Thompson, the CEO of UnitedHealth’s insurance unit, was fatally shot outside a Midtown Manhattan hotel in what police described as a “brazen” targeted attack by a gunman lying in wait for him. What do you think? The post UnitedHealthcare CEO Killed appeared first on The Onion.

title: Judge Delays Decision After Learning One Menendez Brother Always Lies, One Always Tells The Truth
description: LOS ANGELES—Appearing stumped by the convicted murderers’ testimony, Los Angeles Superior Court Judge Michael Jesic reportedly delayed his decision Thursday in the resentencing of Lyle and Erik Menendez after learning that one brother always lies, and one always tells the truth. “Oh jeez, this is tough, and to make it even worse, they say I […] The post Judge Delays Decision After Learning One Menendez Brother Always Lies, One Always Tells The Truth appeared first on The Onion.
